column1: ANTISOCIAL    2    You find the presence of others uncomfortable
column2: so much so that it is immediately obvious to those around you. Your preference for solitude causes you to behave in a manner that might best be described as rude. If you take the 2 point version of this Disadvantage
column3: you suffer a penalty of -1k0 to all Social Skill Rolls. For 4 points
column4: the penalty is -1k1. This Disadvantage is worth 1 additional point to Crab characters.

column1: ASCETIC    2    You have no taste for or interest in material things
column2: and this minimalist attitude has impacted how others view you. Your School Outfit includes only weapons
column3: armor
column4: clothing
column5: necessary tools of the trade for your profession (such as a scroll satchel for shugenja)
column6: and nothing else. Any time you would be awarded Glory as a result of your actions
column7: you receive only half the normal amount. Coupled with the normal restriction for Monks in gaining Glory
column8: ascetic monk characters would only gain one quarter the normal amount of Glory. This Disadvantage is worth 3 points to Dragon and monk characters.

column1: BAD EYESIGHT    3    Your eyesight is exceptionally poor
column2: whether as a result of some medical condition or even from a missing eye. You suffer a penalty of -1k1 to all ranged attack rolls and to any Perception-based rolls.

column1: BAD FORTUNE    3    Kharma is a powerful force
column2: and sometimes it is a destructive one as well. There is something unpleasant in store for you
column3: and you may have no idea what it is until it is far too late. Bad fortunes take an almost infinite variety of forms
column4: all worth the same number of points
column5: and players and GMs should discuss the form of a Bad Fortune during character creation.

column1: BAD HEALTH    4    You suffer from a chronic medical condition that constantly renders you weak and susceptible to both illness and injury. Your Earth Ring is considered one rank lower for the purposes of determining Wound Ranks and for resisting diseases.
BITTER BETROTHAL    2    You have been promised to another
column2: or perhaps are already married
column3: and neither of you are at all pleased with the situation. Your spouse despises you
column4: but he or she at least has the decorum to manage your estate properly… for the most part. Your mutual dislike
column5: however
column6: can result in tremendous difficulty with even simple domestic or bureaucratic tasks. This Disadvantage is worth 3 points to Imperial characters.

column1: BLACK SHEEP    3    For whatever reason
column2: your family is completely disgusted with you and your actions. You have not been cast out and made ronin
column3: but you are no longer welcome in your own household. You may only maintain proper relations with any member of your family via the Allies Advantage
column4: and if you attend one of your own family’s Schools
column5: you may not advance in School Rank without going to great lengths to fi nd a willing teacher.

column1: BLIND    6    You possess no natural eyesight whatsoever save for a slight ability to determine light and dark. You suffer a penalty of -3k3 to all ranged attack rolls and -1k1 to melee attack rolls. Your base Armor TN is equal to your Refl exes Trait plus 5 (armor adds bonuses as normal). Your Water Ring is considered two ranks lower for the purposes of determining how far you may move as part of a Move Action. Any attempt at a Simple Move Action requires an Athletics/Agility roll (TN 20) or you are knocked Prone. You may not make Perception rolls unless the GM judges that you can use senses other than sight for the roll.
BRASH    3    You have a notoriously short temper and are likely to answer anything you perceive as a threat with steel. If you are threatened or insulted
column2: you must make a Willpower Trait roll (adding your Honor Rank to the total) at a TN of 25
column3: or you will attack immediately. This Disadvantage is worth 4 points to Lion characters.

column1: CAN’T LIE    2    You are psychologically incapable of telling a lie
column2: perhaps because it has been so thoroughly drilled into your nature by your honorable family. Not only can you not tell a lie
column3: but if someone in your presence tells a lie and you know that it is untrue
column4: you must succeed at a Willpower Trait Roll (TN 20) or immediately correct them. This can cause untold difficulty in court settings and can lead to complete disgrace if you are not careful.

column1: CAST OUT    3    You
column2: or perhaps your entire line
column3: were at some point denounced by an order of monks
column4: an act that can bring shame to even the least pious samurai. One point in this Disadvantage indicates the disapproval of a single temple
column5: while three points represents a major sect within the Brotherhood of Shinsei. Monks of this sect treat you as if your Glory Rank were in fact Infamy (see the Infamous Disadvantage).

column1: COMPULSION    2    There is some activity in which you are hopelessly compelled to partake. It is a ritual that is so ingrained in your behavior that it requires a feat of will to forsake it
column2: even in dire circumstances. This may be something illicit and addictive
column3: such as sake or gambling
column4: or it may be as innocuous as visiting every major temple you pass. The basic Disadvantage requires a Willpower Trait Roll of TN 15 to overcome. The TN of the roll increases by 5 for every additional point gained by the Disadvantage
column5: to a maximum of TN 25 (4 points).

column1: CONTRARY    3    Your strong will and rigid view of the world insists not only that you develop an opinion on everything
column2: but that you must share it at every opportunity. During any debate or dispute
column3: or even casual discussion
column4: you feel compelled to weigh in and attempt to persuade others to see the matter from your point of view. In any tense situation
column5: you must succeed at a Willpower Trait Roll to avoid taking action
column6: whether to resolve a conflict physically or simply to interject into an argument. The TN for this roll can vary widely
column7: and should be determined by the GM (typically somewhere between 5 and 25). This Disadvantage is worth 4 points to Imperial and courtier characters.

column1: CURSED BY THE REALM    4    The influence of the spirit realms can be felt throughout the mortal realm of Ningen-do
column2: and for whatever reason
column3: the essence of one realm in particular has marked you as a foe of all that emanate from that realm. This Disadvantage is worth 5 points to shugenja characters.

column1: DARK FATE    3    There is a destiny of tremendous signifi cance in store for you
column2: and sadly it is not an illustrious one. Before your death
column3: you will usher tremendous darkness into the world in some way. Perhaps you will allow family secrets to fall into the hands of enemies
column4: or perhaps you will allow the Great Kaiu Wall to fall to the Shadowlands. Destiny protects those for whom it has great plans
column5: even if they do not desire it. Once per session
column6: when you suffer Wounds that would kill you
column7: you are instead reduced to one Wound.

column1: DARK SECRET    4    You possess some horrifi c secret that could lead not only to your ruination
column2: but perhaps others in your family as well. It may be something terrible you have learned about your family that you alone know (if a venerated ancestor was secretly a dishonorable buffoon)
column3: or something you personally have done (you may be a member of the Kolat or Gozoku). If your secret is exposed
column4: you may be required to commit seppuku or possibly even be executed. This Disadvantage is worth 5 points to ninja characters.

column1: DISHONORED    5    You have been dishonored so spectacularly that your name has been removed from your family’s records
column2: and most within the family act as if you were dead. However
column3: the Clan has granted you the opportunity to wash away your dishonor if you perish in battle. This custom
column4: which started with the Lion Clan
column5: is known as the Deathseeker tradition. You possess Status Rank 1 and may not gain Status so long as you possess this Disadvantage.

column1: DISBELIEVER    3    You have experienced a dramatic revelation that has shattered your faith in Rokugani theology. Perhaps you believe that the Fortunes have no interest in mankind
column2: or perhaps you have come to believe that the Tao of Shinsei holds nothing but empty promises. If your disbelief were made public knowledge
column3: you would be shunned by all properly pious in-dividuals everywhere
column4: and any memberships you possess in temples or monastic orders would be instantly revoked. Your lack of piety makes you uncomfortable around shugenja and monks
column5: and any Social Skill Rolls made with them have their TN increased by +5.

column1: DISTURBING COUNTENANCE    3    Something about your appearance causes others to respond to you with concern and caution. You are not necessarily unattractive
column2: merely disturbing in some way. The TN of all your Social Skill Rolls is increased by +5. This Disadvantage is worth 4 points to Spider characters.

column1: DOUBT    4    Something has happened to cause you to question your training
column2: so much so that it interferes with your ability to perform properly. Select one of your School Skills. Every time you use this Skill
column3: you must declare one Raise that confers no benefit.

column1: DRIVEN    2    You are possessed by some goal
column2: and will sacrifice almost anything to accomplish it
column3: even your honor. Family
column4: friends
column5: material possessions
column6: and even Bushido mean nothing compared to the potential completion of this goal

column1: ELEMENTAL IMBALANCE    2    The kami of one element favor you
column2: but so much so that their voices sometimes overpower your will and cause your invocations to achieve results other than what you intended. Only shugenja may take this Disadvantage. Choose an element in which you do not possess a Defi ciency. Whenever you cast a spell of this element
column3: you must make a Willpower Trait Roll at TN 15 + 5 per rank of this Disadvantage. If you fail the roll
column4: something disastrous happens. The spell may fail outright
column5: it may target someone altogether different from who you intended
column6: or other effects as determined by the GM.

column1: EPILEPSY    4    You possess a rare and poorly understood condition that causes you to experience seizures from time to time
column2: consisting of a trance-like state
column3: rigid muscle spasms
column4: and frothing at the mouth. These are brought on by high stress or flashing lights
column5: such as fi reworks displays. Under such circumstances
column6: you must succeed at a Willpower Trait Roll at TN 15 to avoid the seizure. If you fail
column7: you experience a seizure and may roll a second Willpower Trait Roll (TN 10) each minute to end it. This Disadvantage is worth 5 points to Crane characters.

column1: FASCINATION    1    You are completely fascinated by some subject
column2: and will go to great lengths to learn more about it or to experience it in new ways. Typical subjects of a samurai’s fascination include music
column3: horses
column4: poetry
column5: and history. This fascination badly impedes your judgment
column6: and you will take even dishonorable actions to learn more
column7: which could end in absolute disgrace if your actions are discovered.

column1: FORCED RETIREMENT    4    You have been forced into early retirement by entering a monastery
column2: perhaps due to political reasons or because of some public disgrace. You may not advance any further in your School. When you gain a new Insight Rank
column3: you must instead begin taking ranks of an unaligned Monk School (see the Book of Water). You need not purchase the Multiple Schools Advantage for this. You are no longer considered a member of your Clan. This Disadvantage is worth 5 points to monk characters.

column1: FRAIL MIND    3    You have difficulty concentrating
column2: even when focusing your attention on an opponent. Whenever you make a Contested Roll using Willpower
column3: your opponent gains a bonus of +2k0.

column1: GAIJIN NAME    1    Either due to your lineage or your parents’ fascination with another culture
column2: you possess a name that is clearly not of Rokugani origin. Although there is no honor loss for such a thing
column3: others regard you questionably as a result. Your individual dice may only explode once on a Social Skill Roll (that is
column4: each die has a maximum possible result of 20). This Disadvantage

column1: GREEDY    3    Material wealth is more important to you than anything else
column2: even though samurai are not meant to be sullied with commercial interests. Opponents attempting to use Temptation (Bribery) rolls against you gain a bonus of +1k1 to the total of the roll. This Disadvantage is worth 4 points to Mantis characters.

column1: GULLIBLE    4    Your trust is given easily and you place tremendous faith in those whom you trust
column2: unfortunately making it very simple for others to take advantage of your naïve nature. Opponents attempting to use Sincerity (Deceit) against you gain a bonus of +1k1 to the total of their rolls.

column1: HAUNTED    3    One of your ancestors has chosen to bestow personal attention on you
column2: constantly offering you advice and making demands. Perhaps the ancestor merely wishes you to live up to the ideals of your Clan and family
column3: or perhaps he has some unfinished task or duty which he wishes you to complete. You must show all due deference and respect to your ancestor
column4: and do your best to live up to his (or her) expectations. If you fail to do so
column5: your ancestor’s disapproval will bring bad fortune upon you: so long as your ancestor remains angry
column6: once per session one of your die rolls (chosen by the GM) will suffer a –1k1 penalty.

column1: HOSTAGE    3    In the resolution of a dispute between Clans
column2: it is not uncommonfor hostages to be exchanged as “guests” of one another’s Clans for a specified amount of time. This ensures that the treaty in question is not broken. Although you are treated respectfully and as a guest in the lands of another Clan
column3: you are not permitted to leave without escort and
column4: should war break out between your Clan and your hosts
column5: your life will be forfeit.

column1: IDEALISTIC    2    You adhere closely to the code of Bushido
column2: perhaps too closely
column3: and you have a hopelessly naïve view of the world and how things work. You have impossible standards that not even the most heroic individual could hope to meet
column4: much less you. Whenever you lose Honor
column5: the loss is increased by 1 point. This Disadvantage is worth 3 points to Lion characters.

column1: INFAMOUS    2    You are well known among some circles
column2: but not in the manner you might wish. Rather than being known for your valor and your courage
column3: you are known for being ruthless
column4: cruel
column5: and dangerous. This reputation may not be deserved
column6: but it is widespread enough that it no longer matters if it is true. Your starting Glory Rank is replaced with an Infamy Rank
column7: which serves in exactly the same capacity
column8: save for the reaction of those who recognize you.

column1: INSENSITIVE    2    Your primary interest is in yourself and things that you care about. The plight of others simply does not interest you
column2: and you find it difficult to pretend otherwise. With the exception of those who contribute directly to your well being
column3: such as your lord
column4: you must spend a Void Point to place yourself at risk for the welfare of any other person unless there is an immediate benefit for you personally. This Disadvantage is worth 3 points to Scorpion characters.

column1: JEALOUSY    3    You are obsessed with outperforming another individual in order to prove that you deserve all the things he has
column2: things you perceive as superior to your own. Choose one other PC or a major NPC in your campaign. You are obsessed with overcoming them at all costs
column3: and will go to any lengths to do so. Once you have bested the target of your jealousy
column4: your nature will cause you to become jealous of someone else.

column1: LAME    4    One of your legs is withered or perhaps even near-useless
column2: either due to a birth defect
column3: a crippling injury
column4: or a ravaging disease. Your Water Ring is considered 1 for the purposes of determining Move Actions
column5: and any Agility Trait Rolls or Agility-based Skill Rolls that require any sort of activity in your lower limbs suffer a penalty of +10 to the TN.

column1: LECHERY    2    Physical pleasure is a weakness of yours
column2: and you spend considerable time pursuing it. When an opponent makes a Temptation (Seduction) roll against you
column3: he gains a bonus of +1k1 to the total of his roll.

column1: LORD MOON’S CURSE    7    The madness of Lord Moon
column2: Onnotangu
column3: lingers in your soul
column4: driving you to fi ts of madness despite your increased understanding of the universe. You gain an additional Void Point at sunset on any night of the full moon. If you do not use this Void Point
column5: it is lost with the sunrise. However
column7: you must make a Willpower Trait Roll against TN 15 +5 for each level in this Disadvantage after the fi rst.  If you fail the roll
column8: you lose control of your character for the evening. You awaken the next morning with no idea what atrocious acts you might have committed…

column1: LOST LOVE    3    You shared a bond of true love with someone once
column2: and have since lost it. This need not be romantic love
column3: as familial or brotherly love lost is equally tragic. You tend to suffer bouts of melancholy when reminded of your lost love. When you are reminded of your loss
column4: all your TNs are increased by 5 until you spend a Void Point to regain your focus. This disruption of your concentration cannot happen more than twice per day
column5: and at least one hour must pass between instances.

column1: LOW PAIN THRESHOLD    4    Your ability to focus in the face of pain is less than that of others. The TN penalties you suffer due to Wound Ranks are increased by +5 each rank.
MISSING LIMB    6    One of your limbs is missing
column2: either through catastrophic injury or due to an unfortunate defect of your birth. You suffer a penalty of +10 to all TNs involving the use of the limb missing. For example
column3: wielding a two-handed meleeWeapon with only one arm would have a +10 to all TNs
column4: but an Athletics (Running) Skill Roll would not.

column1: MOMOKU    8    There is a fundamental spiritual imbalance present in your soul that no one can explain or rectify
column2: but it has a dramatic impact on your place within the universe
column3: and harmony is a state virtually unknown to you. You possess Void Points
column4: but you may not spend them on anything except School Techniques which specifically require Void Points. The basic uses of Void Points listed in the Book of Earth are unavailable to you.

column1: OBLIGATION    6    There is someone to whom you are indebted or for whom you must fulfill some significant duty. The nature of this debt can vary considerably
column2: but when it comes due
column3: nothing else matters. You must honor it
column4: even if it leads to your ruination. The fi rst level of this Disadvantage is a relatively minor matter that nevertheless demands your full attention. The second level represents a major
column5: significant obligation that could potentially damage your family’s standing if you do not devote considerable time and resources to fulfilling it.

column1: OBTUSE    3    The point of many fi ne things simply escapes you. Poetry
column2: art
column3: music… it all seems meaningless to you. The Experience Point cost for increasing any High Skill other than Investigation or Medicine is doubled. This Disadvantage is worth 4 points to Crab and bushi characters.

column1: OVERCONFIDENT    3    You possess a grossly inflated view of your own prowess
column2: and are often incapable of recognizing when a situation is beyond your ability to handle. When outnumbered or facing a clearly superior enemy (whether in court or in battle)
column3: you must succeed at a Perception Trait Roll (TN 20) in order to recognize the situation for what it is and leave instead of engaging. This Disadvantage is worth 4 points to Lion and Mantis characters.

column1: PERMANENT WOUND    4    Some wounds will not heal
column2: not matter how often they are treated or by what means. Your first Wound Rank is always considered full. This Disadvantage is worth 5 points to bushi characters.

column1: PHOBIA    3    You possess an irrational fear that you cannot overcome
column2: no matter how much you struggle to convince yourself that there is no reason behind it. When confronted with the object of your phobia
column3: all of your TNs are increased by +5 for every point you possess in this Disadvantage.

column1: RUMORMONGER    4    You cannot resist the temptation to spread rumors and gossip
column2: no matter how ridiculous or outlandish they might seem. When presented with an opportunity to spread rumors
column3: to resist doing so you must succeed at a Willpower Trait Roll with a TN equal to 5x the Glory Rank of the highest-Glory individual involved in the rumor. This Disadvantage is worth 5 points to courtier characters.

column1: SHADOWLANDS TAINT    4    You have felt the touch of darkness
column2: and it has not left you unscathed. You possess the Shadowlands Taint
column3: a condition that makes you hopelessly spiritually lost in the eyes of virtually the entire Empire
column4: and which is essentially incurable. You have 0.5 ranks of Shadowlands Taint. It is up to you whether you are actually aware of your Taint
column5: since it is not detectable at this level.

column1: SMALL    3    You are noticeably smaller than average for a denizen of the Emerald Empire. As a result
column2: your Water Ring is considered one rank lower for determining the distance of your Move Actions
column3: and you suffer a penalty of -1k0 on the Damage Rolls of all your melee attacks. You may not take the Large Advantage.

column1: SOCIAL DISADVANTAGE    3    You have slipped from your position within the Celestial Order
column2: and your place in society reflects that. You begin with Status Rank 0.

column1: SOFT-HEARTED    2    Human life is precious to you
column2: so much so that you have difficulty executing the basic duty of the samurai caste: to kill. When faced with the opportunity to kill another human being
column3: you must succeed at a Willpower Trait Roll (TN 20)
column4: or you are unable to do so. If you do kill another
column5: the TNs of all your rolls are increased by +10 for one day as you are wracked with guilt. This penalty is not cumulative with multiple deaths. This Disadvantage could potentially also apply to killing nonhuman creatures or even Shadowlands monsters
column6: although the Experience Point value should be increased in such cases. This Disadvantage is worth 3 points to Phoenix characters.

column1: SWORN ENEMY    3    You have earned an enemy
column2: one who will stop at nothing to see you defeated or even killed. The basic version of this Advantage assumes that your enemy is of equal Insight Rank. For each Insight Rank above yours your enemy possesses
column3: increase the value of this Disadvantage by 1. For 2 additional points
column4: the enemy becomes your kharmic nemesis
column5: and you may not spend Void Points when opposing him or her in any situation.

column1: TOUCH OF THE VOID    3    You have been touched by the essence of the Void
column2: and it has forever damaged your mind. Whenever you draw upon the Void
column3: the effect is powerful
column4: but can overwhelm you. When you spend a Void Point to augment a roll
column5: you gain a bonus of +2k1 instead of +1k1. Every time you spend a Void Point
column7: you must succeed at a Willpower Trait Roll (TN 30) or be Dazed for one Round. This Disadvantage is worth 4 points to Phoenix characters.

column1: TRUE LOVE    3    True love in Rokugan can be a wonderful experience
column2: but more often than not it is a disaster
column3: for it is rare for samurai to be allowed to marry for love. Whenever you are in a position where you must choose between love and duty
column4: you must spend a Void Point before you can choose your duty over your lover.

column1: UNLUCKY    2    Fortune favors the mortal man… just not in your case. A number of times per session equal to your rank in this Disadvantage
column2: the GM may force you to immediately re-roll one roll
column3: keeping the second roll in all cases.

column1: WEAKNESS    6    You have a significant weakness of some sort
column2: either physical or mental
column3: that is difficult to overcome even under ideal circumstances. Select one Trait. That Trait is treated as if it were one rank lower for the purposes of all rolls and Trait-based mechanical effects.

column1: WRATH OF THE KAMI    3    The spirits of a particular element have a vehement dislike for you
column2: and when invoked to smite you
column3: they gleefully and enthusiastically comply. This may be the result of a shugenja’s curse
column4: an offense you offered to the Fortunes
column5: or a variety of other spiritual causes. Select one element when you purchase this Disadvantage. Spells of this element cast against you confer one Free Raise on the Spell Casting Roll. This Disadvantage is worth 4 points to shugenja characters.
